title: Inflation rate in Zimbabwe 2024
yAxis: Inflation rate compared to previous year
summary: This is a line chart with an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Inflation rate compared to previous year, containing a total of 41 data points.
Overall Inflation rate compared to previous year has increased over the Year.
The chart generally has many fluctuations.

The line significantly increased by 14.15 from Year 1984 to 1985,remained stable by 11.73 from Year 1987 to 1988,increased by 2.79 from Year 1988 to 1989,increased by 11.79 from Year 1990 to 1991,remained stable by 10.14 from Year 1991 to 1992,remained stable by 2.62 from Year 1992 to 1993,increased by 2.38 from Year 1993 to 1994,increased by 12.47 from Year 1994 to 1995,remained stable by 5.04 from Year 1996 to 1997,increased by 27.05 from Year 1997 to 1998,increased by 32.72 from Year 2000 to 2001,remained stable by 25.88 from Year 2002 to 2003,increased by 105.0 from Year 2003 to 2004,remained stable by 82.05 from Year 2004 to 2005,remained stable by 39.76 from Year 2006 to 2007,remained stable by 84.23 from Year 2007 to 2008,remained stable by 150.74 from Year 2008 to 2009,remained stable by 1.42 from Year 2013 to 2014,increased by 2.2 from Year 2014 to 2015,increased by 9.7 from Year 2017 to 2018,increased by 151.2 from Year 2018 to 2019, and lastly, remained stable by 46.0 from Year 2020 to 2021.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2018 and 2019.
Maximum Inflation rate compared to previous year, about 161.81 was reported at Year 2019
The lowest Inflation rate compared to previous year, of value 0.21 was reported at Year 2014

max_summary: The chart in general has a zig-zag shape.

The line rapidly increased by 760.75% from Year 1984 to 1985,remained stable by 91.71% from Year 1987 to 1988,increased by 263.21% from Year 1988 to 1989,increased by 873.33% from Year 1990 to 1991,remained stable by 77.17% from Year 1991 to 1992,remained stable by 87.33% from Year 1992 to 1993,increased by 626.32% from Year 1993 to 1994,increased by 451.81% from Year 1994 to 1995,remained stable by 83.86% from Year 1996 to 1997,increased by 2788.66% from Year 1997 to 1998,increased by 730.36% from Year 2000 to 2001,remained stable by 75.12% from Year 2002 to 2003,increased by 1225.2% from Year 2003 to 2004,remained stable by 72.25% from Year 2004 to 2005,remained stable by 120.59% from Year 2006 to 2007,remained stable by 115.81% from Year 2007 to 2008,remained stable by 96.04% from Year 2008 to 2009,remained stable by 87.12% from Year 2013 to 2014,increased by 1047.62% from Year 2014 to 2015,increased by 1065.93% from Year 2017 to 2018,increased by 1425.07% from Year 2018 to 2019, and lastly, remained stable by 92.56% from Year 2020 to 2021.
